definition: (of a child bride) to consummate marriage
circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: She this creating is just numerous long period, which so simple is pregnant?
sentences.chinese: 她这圆房才多长时间，哪那么容易就有身孕？

sentences.english: In divorce proceedings, she claimed they never consummated their union.
sentences.chinese: 之后，在办离婚手续中，简称他们从未圆房过。

definition: bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to share the bed/(fig.) to be married
to make a pledge to be married, without parents' approval
to take a wife/to get married (man)
